used as fuel for heating and electricity generation.', 'Ink - A colored liquid composed primarily of dyes, with pigments suspended in it, commonly used for writing or printing; various types can have a very dark black coloration.', 'Smoke - The visible vapor and gases given off by something burning, typically having a grayish-black appearance when produced from substances like wood or fossil fuels.', 'Midnight - A metaphorical term for the deepest part of the night when darkness prevails; also used to describe an object with an extremely dark black hue.', 'Jet - The compressed, high-density form of carbonaceous material derived from organic matter like wood or bone, often used in jewelry and industrial applications; a deep, rich black color.', 'Graphite - A crystalline form of carbon with a layered structure that is opaque and dark gray to black in appearance, commonly used for writing instruments and lubricants.', 'Shadow - An area where light has been blocked by an object, creating a region characterized by darkness; usually appearing very black compared to the surrounding surroundings.', 'Moonless night - The absence of moonlight during the darkest part of the lunar cycle (new moon), resulting in a naturally dark environment with exceptional levels of darkness.', 'Obsidian - A natural volcanic glass formed from rapidly cooled lava, typically black and sharp-edged; used to make jewelry or decorative objects.', 'Black hole - An astronomical object with gravitational pull so strong that nothing, not even light, can escape it; often depicted as a void of infinite darkness in space.', 'Bone ash - The residual black substance left after burning bones for cremation purposes or creating pigments and dyes; typically a deep brownish-black color but still associated with the darker spectrum.', 'Charred wood - Wood that has been burned, resulting in a darkened, charred appearance; often used for artistic purposes like woodturning.', 'Ebonywood (another term referring to ebony)', 'Shadow blackness - The extreme darkness achieved by blocking all light sources and the resulting visual perception of complete absence of light; metaphorically used for an object with a very dark appearance resembling the deepest shadows.', 'Dark matter - A hypothetical form of exotic matter that does not interact with electromagnetic force, making it invisible to most detection methods but inferred from its gravitational effects on visible matter and radiation; often associated with darkness in a cosmic context.', 'Nightmare blackness - The intense visual sensation of pitch-black darkness or deepest shadows that can evoke fear or discomfort, typically used to describe an environment or imagery associated with nightmares.', 'Solid carbon - Pure form of carbon in its most stable state; composed entirely of black atoms arranged into different allotropes such as graphite, diamond, and fullerenes; often referred to metaphorically for the absolute absence of light or color.']
